page.title: 13ROADS
page.content: The conservation situation in the Chale Green/Roud area is not adequate. In Roud the roads are well kept, but the roads passing through the area and Chale Green have been described by the local residents as unsuitable. Unfortunately the roads are not repaired on a regular basis. The same is true for the buildings and monuments owned by the National Trust. Even the pond in Chale Green is stagnant. A lot more general repairs need to be carried out in this picturesque area of the Island. Chale Green and Roud are both small settlements, and so are without a booming tourist trade. In fact there is only one guesthouse in the area! Most people who stay at the 'Halls' guesthouse in Chale Green probably go there for the scenic views and the numerous footpaths.
